In medicine, a 'pancreatectomy' is the surgical removal of all or part of the
pancreas. Several types of pancreatectomy exist, including
pancreaticoduodenectomy (Whipple procedure), distal pancreatectomy, segmental
pancreatectomy, and total pancreatectomy. These procedures are used in the
management of several conditions involving the pancreas, such as benign
pancreatic tumors, pancreatic cancer, and pancreatitis.
